thread.title: Scare up some Halloween spirit in the Keys | www.palmbeachpost.com
thread.title_full: Scare up some Halloween spirit in the Keys | www.palmbeachpost.com

author: Mary Thurwachter
title: Scare up some Halloween spirit in the Keys | www.palmbeachpost.com
text:
Headed to the Keys for Halloween? Spooky events abound.
Here are a few:
A float rolls down Duval Street during the 2013 Fantasy Fest Parade in Key West. The parade is the highlight of the 10-day Fantasy Fest costuming and masking festival. (Andy Newman/Florida Keys News Bureau) * The theme of Key West’s annual Fantasy Fest, Oct. 23 through Nov. 1, is “All Hallows Intergalactic Freak Show” and includes 10 days of masquerade balls, costume contests, parties and uninhibited escapades, all culminating in the 3Wishes.com Fantasy Fest Parade Oct. 31.
The festival’s traditional Children’s Day, from noon to 5 p.m. on Nov. 1, features food, games, rides, arts and crafts and a costume contest. The fun takes place at Bayview Park at Truman Avenue and Eisenhower Drive.
* Artists and creative spirits will display miniature floats in Key West’s “Smallest Parade in the Universe” from 5-9 p.m. Oct. 29 at Waterfront Brewery, at 201 William St. Floats cannot exceed a length or height of 18 inches or a width of 12 inches. Each float’s visuals and theme must be PG-13-rated.
Deirdre Robbins displays her costume during Fantasy Fest in Key West (Andy Newman/Florida Keys News Bureau/HO) The tiny floats will be displayed on a specially crafted replica of Key West’s Duval Street and projections will be flashed on the “street” to make them look like full-sized parade floats. For more information, visit www.thesmallestparadeintheuniverse.com or www.marchouse.org .
For Fantasy Fest information, call 305-292-8912 or visit www.fantasyfest.com .
* An Underwater Pumpkin Carving Contest in Key Largo on Saturday has divers competing for praise and prizes. The contest is open to certified scuba divers. While underwater, two-person teams carve pumpkins into imaginative jack-o’-lanterns. Call 800-426-6729 or visit www.amoray.com .
Participants in an Underwater Pumpkin Carving Contest posed with their creations in the Florida Keys National Marine Sanctuary off Key Largo. (Bob Care/Florida Keys News Bureau) * At Crane Point Hammock’s Creepy Carnival starting at 6 p.m. Oct. 30, children venture into the hammock to see special guests like the Bearded Lady, Crazy Clowns and Wolfman. Geared toward children 12 and under, the event is free. Call 305-743-3900 or visit www.cranepoint.net .
* The historic U.S. Coast Guard Cutter Ingham, docked at Key West’s Truman Waterfront and operating as a maritime museum, will host an interactive experience titled “King Neptune’s Curse: Aliens vs. Coast Guard.” The Coast Guard and attendees will battle “aliens” trying to take over the USCGC Ingham. Each compartment will have various challenges for attendees to complete to “protect” the ship.
Shows are scheduled each evening Oct. 22-30 except Oct. 26 and 29. Tickets are $15 per adult, $10 per person for active military personnel and $8 per child age 12 and under. 305-292-5072
Places to stay
Rooms are always hard to find during Key West’s popular Fantasy Fest. The Duval Collection, an eclectic assortment of inns, resorts and amenities, has guest rooms and suites available. Guests choose from options at Pier House Resort & Spa, La Concha Key West or The Southernmost House to be in close proximity to both extravaganzas. Rates are starting at $625 at Pier House ( www.pierhouse.com ); $699 at La Concha, ( www.laconchakeywest.com ); and $445 at Southernmost House ( www.southernmosthouse.com ).
Another option is the Gates Hotel, sponsor of the Zombie Bike Ride, which takes place Oct. 25.
Revelers channel their inner zombie, ghoul or ghost and join thousands of bike-riding and costume-sporting riders during the leisurely 4-mile route down U.S. 1 along the Atlantic Ocean. Participants ride scenic South Roosevelt Boulevard, before winding through Old Town Key West and ending with a block party on Duval Street.
The Gates Hotel offers accommodations, entrance into the Zombie Bike Ride, a Gates Cruiser to ride during the event and ghoulish face paint at the hotel from professional body painters and airbrush artists.
The Zombie Bike Ride package at the Gates is available to book from now through Oct. 26. For reservations or information, call 305-320-0930 or visit www.gateshotelkeywest.com .
